Triggering Messages

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe how event messages are triggered
* Create destinations and configure required
fields

| Use case — Bank account verification Gi

¢ Trigger a message when a bank 1

. Configure the bank account entity
account is added or modified

to trigger messages
¢ Create an abstract representation of 2

an external system to define the key Deploy code changes
messaging components ,

. Create a messaging destination

| Guidewire servers and messaging transactions Gi

¢ All activity from event triggering takes place in transaction 1
* Messaging occurs across multiple transactions

¢ If an exception is thrown, work in the current transaction is rolled back

Messaging entities

| EventAware entity

« Amessaging event often occurs when
adding, changing, or removing an instance
of an EventAware entity

¢ An EventAware entity delegates to
EventAware delegate

* Configured by adding the events Element to the BankAccount (abx_bankaccount)

entity

Implements the default set of messaging events:
Added, Changed and Removed

Naming convention

+ <EventAwareEntityName><ChangeType>

* Custom message events can be added

Example: Custom BankAccountFlagged message

ar

Gi

BB eankAccount.eti
(se event v — [YVshowalv]) g = = AO

Y entity BankAccount Contact bank account
implementsEntity _Extractable

BankAccountFlagged

Attributes: Editable’, Exportable”, Extendable”, Final”, Keyed”, Loadable”, Sourceable”
Messaging Events: The application will generate these events for this entity:

| Triggering custom message events Gi

Element Primary Value Secondary Value

© entity BankAccount Contact bank account

implementsEntity _Extractable

event BankAccountFlagged Custom BankAccountFlagged Event

¢ Useful when messaging must be initiated by something that cannot be captured in
a standard (built-in) message event

* Syntax

* eventAwareEntityInstance.addEvent ("CustomEventName")
* Only for EventAware entity

+ Triggered manually in code

*« Example: aBankAccount.addEvent ("BankAccountFlagged")

| MessageContext entity

¢ An internal, non-persistent, virtual
entity

* Only used in event fired rules
¢ Important fields
* DestID
+ Identifies the subscribing destination
+ EventName
+ Identifies the name of the triggering event
+ Root

+ Can be used to reference data from the
triggering entity

Gi

MessageContext (Virtual) (delegates to Versionable)
> Description

Attributes: Extendable’, Final’, Keyed’, Sourceable”

Show user interface details on all fields

Fields | Arrays

Fields
DestID Derived property returning int (virtual property)”
EventName Derived property returning java.lang String (virtual property)”

Root Derived property returning java.lang.Object (virtual property)”

+ Example: messageContext.Root typeis BankAccount

| Message entity

An entity containing message details and payload to
be sent to an external system

DestinationID

+ Identifies the subscribing destination

EventName

+ Identifies the name of the triggering event
MessageRoot

+ ls a pointer to the triggering event-aware entity instance
Payload

+ Holds the information to communicate

SenderReflD

+ Is asender reference number typically set at message send time
Status

+ Message status pending and errored messages

« Amessaging destination is an abstraction of an external system

* Subscribes to message events of interest

* Defines list of message plugins used in processing outbound request messages and received
inbound replies

¢ Defines connectivity, retryable error parameters, predictable message ordering, multithreading,
and distributed actions

| Destination message events

* Messaging destination subscribes to one or more specific message events
¢« When a message event occurs:
* One MessageContext instance is created for each destination that listens to that event

« Each MessageContext object is then processed by the event fired business rules

| Defining a message destination

¢ Destinations are defined in the
messaging-config.xml file

¢ Under configuration.config.Messaging
¢ To create a new destination, click the
plus symbol and define the required
fields
¢ ID: unique ID value from 0 to 63

« Name: unique name displayed in the Ul
messaging administration screen

¢ Transport Plugin: sends message to
external system(s)

+ Discussed in Sending Messages lesson

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

,- — When does a message event get triggered?

7
¢
4

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer

,- — When does a message event get triggered?

¢
¢
4

Typically, a message event gets triggered when an event-aware entity is created,
changed, or removed.

Soo eS oe ese Sse ese

Question

an What is the primary purpose of the MessageContext entity?
¢
4

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer

ae What is the primary purpose of the MessageContext entity?

¢
4

The primary purpose of the MessageContext entity is to create messages using
information from the message event and the triggering entity.

Soo eS oe ese Sse ese

Question

_ _ AGuidewire application has seven destinations and an event-aware
7’ entity called Escalation.

y 4 A) When an Escalation is created, what is the maximum number of

MessageContexts that might get created?

B) What is the minimum?

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer Gi

_ _ AGuidewire application has seven destinations and an event-aware
7 entity called Escalation.

y A) When an Escalation is created, what is the maximum number of
MessageContexts that might get created?

B) What is the minimum?

A) Seven, which would occur if all seven destinations listen to EscalationAdded.
B) Zero, which would occur if none of the destinations listen to EscalationAdded.

Soo eS oe ese Sse ese

Question G

an What plugin is required for every destination? What does this plugin do?

¢
4

Se Soe Se sees esse ese

Answer Gi

ae What plugin is required for every destination? What does this plugin do?

¢
4

MessageTransport, which sends the message to the external system.

Soo eS oe ese Sse ese
